column1: CMOR Table OImon: Monthly Mean Ocean Cryosphere Fields
(All saved on the ocean grid; unless otherwise indicated, values are averaged over only the ocean portion of each grid cell and report 0.0 where ocean fraction is 0.)

column4: comment
column10: cell_methods

column4: fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice.
column10: time: mean

column4: Compute the mean thickness of sea ice in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the ice-free fraction).  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Compute the  mass per unit area of sea ice plus snow in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the ice-free fraction).  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Evaporation Flux from Sea Ice
column4: Compute the average rate that water mass evaporates (or sublimates) from the sea ice surface (i.e., kg/s) divided by the area of the ocean (i.e., open ocean + sea ice) portion of the grid cell. This quantity multiplied both by the oean area of the grid cell and by the length of the month should yield the total mass of water evaporated (or sublimated) from the sea ice.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.  [This was computed differently in CMIP3
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column4: Compute the mean thickness of snow in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the snow-free ocean fraction).  Report as 0.0 in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Fraction of entire grid cell covered by snow that lies on sea ice; exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.
column10: time: mean

column4: Report as "missing" if there is no sunlight or if a region is free of sea ice.
column5: This variable may be omitted unless the answers to the following questions are obvious:  Will this vary from year to year or is it a property of "bare sea ice" and sun angle? How is the time-mean calculated?
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice

column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the mass of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by mass of sea ice)

column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the area of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.  Note this will be the surface snow temperature in regions where snow covers the sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: Temperature at Interface Between Sea Ice and Snow
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the area of snow-covered sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Report as "missing" in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of snow-covered sea ice)

column2: Surface Rainfall Rate into the Sea Ice Portion of the Grid Cell
column4: where sea ice over sea: compute the the water mass per unit time falling as rain onto the sea ice portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell (including both ice-free and sea-ice covered fractions).  Report as 0. in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: Surface Snowfall Rate into the Sea Ice Portion of the Grid Cell
column4: where sea ice over sea: compute the the water mass per unit time falling as snow onto the sea ice portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell (including both ice-free and sea-ice covered fractions).  Report as 0. in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted b mass of sea ice)

column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to frazil sea ice formation divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to congelation sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to lateral growth alone of the sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Compute the rate of change of snow mass  due to melting, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.  Include falling snow that melts on impact with the surface.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Melt at Upper Surface of Sea Ice
column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to melting at its upper surface, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column5: Should this  also include melting of  snow that covers sea ice?
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Melt at Sea Ice Base
column4: Compute the rate of change of sea ice mass due to melting at its lower surface, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column4: Ice at 0 Celsius is assumed taken to have a heat content of 0 J.  When averaging over time, this quantity is weighted by the mass of sea ice.   Report as "missing in regions free of snow on land.
column5: should this include heat content of snow on sea ice?
column10: time: mean (weighted by mass of sea ice)

column4: Compute the downward shortwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column5: priority was raised from 2 to 1 because snow albedo was deleted.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column4: Compute the upward shortwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column5: priority was raised from 2 to 1 because snow albedo was deleted.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: Downward Long Wave over Sea Ice
column4: Compute the downward longwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: Upward Long Wave over Sea Ice
column4: Compute the upward longwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
column4: Compute the upward sensible heat flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
column4: Compute the upward latent heat flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column4: Compute the upward flux of water vapor to the atmosphere due to sublimation of snow and sea  ice in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea

column2: X-Component of Sea Ice Mass Transport
column4: The sea ice transport is 0.0 in ice-free regions of the ocean.  Include snow is calculation of mass.
column10: time: mean

column4: The sea ice transport is 0.0 in ice-free regions of the ocean.  Include snow is calculation of mass.
column10: time: mean

column2: Sea Ice Mass Transport Through Fram Strait
column10: time: mean

column2: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress On Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress On Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: X-Component of Ocean Stress On Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: Y-Component of Ocean Stress On Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: Strain Rate Divergence of Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column2: Strain Rate Shear of Sea Ice
column4: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)

column5: This field may be omitted unless the answers to the following questions are obvious:  How exactly is this defined?  Are time-means weighted by sea ice area?
column10: time: mean
